TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Grunge level 1, 10%, for me. Even for stuff that has just come out the assembly building you can see a little bit of stuff here and there coming into the creases just by sitting at the pad, or being manipulated. If it's not absolutely mission critical, chips of paint *will* fall off, glosses will dull, blacks will decolour at spots, just by cleaning them up. A living vehicle will have been tested and retested, filled and drained, over and over, and at least minimally stained and cleaned and wiped.

 

But not so much. Kerbals might be reckless, but they ain't filthy.

13 hours ago, Beale said:

Grunge. Do you like it? Tell me:

I do. Level 1 seems more sharp than stock and not so different from other parts as L2. Good thing)

On 7/7/2017 at 9:21 PM, Beale said:

Do you like crafts?

Your favourite  @DiscoSlelge did a thing and made a lot!

Grab them from the craft-links on the first page!

 

Crafts look nice but this TKS bugs me a lot... its engines are facing backwards (or actually forwards... TKS is confusing) and are in the wrong place. There is no need for that antenna on top of the VA retro engine. RCS blocks are in a wrong position (although placing correct RCS on a TKS is hard, this placement puts solar panels right in the stream of propellant... I know there is no game effect from it but it bugs me.

I try not to be rude but if you offer these crafts as "beale-approved" I'd expect them to be more authenthic. I do not know the other crafts' real life equivalents so well but this probably should be changed. I do like how awkward and confusing the real TKS was

It's just  a craft you can remove everything you want, so you can be authentic

1 hour ago, TheBedla said:

RCS blocks are in a wrong position (although placing correct RCS on a TKS is hard, this placement puts solar panels right in the stream of propellant... I know there is no game effect from it but it bugs me.

I try not to be rude but if you offer these crafts as "beale-approved" I'd expect them to be more authenthic. I do not know the other crafts' real life equivalents so well but this probably should be changed. I do like how awkward and confusing the real TKS was

I believe that DiscoSlelge's crafts are what works in his game, and he decided to release them for everyone to play with. While they are not real life equivalents to their respective craft, this is KSP, where things don't have to be. I have his craft, and while I prefer my own versions of some of them, I like the others. If you want something more true to life, make it. If you're looking for the TKS thrusters, get them from Contares until Beale makes his own. The LES can be pulled from the old Tantares pack, if you really want it. Do a little research and you can make a pretty accurate TKS, if you so desire. Otherwise, just enjoy what people spend their time to make.

Thanks for the feedback, I have a very accurate TKS that I will upload when I have a chance.

Single accurate engines are coming (Current engines are for the MIR modules), same for the LES.

Gentlemens, it has been a while, salutes to the few who remember me

I am glad to witness the path Tantares took, the new models are neat.

I encourage you Beale to give a chance to grunge, the second option of grunge is very pretty to me, and so are the new FGB tanks, especially with the beige tone you chose. DiscoSlelge's crafts show us how beautiful your parts are and to me they deserve more contrast just as he did, I envy such colours and details, to me they sould be by default to match more the other packs parts and vanilla ones.

 

Greetings to you

Because I can't be bothered to search through the dozens of previous pages to find any post at all that describes it, and because I quite honestly completely forgot, could anyone remind me the diameter of the larger Tantares docking ports. The 0.9-something metre ones.
0.937meters according to the VAB informations
